net.java.jddac.jmdi.service
Interface SubscriberCallback

All Known Implementing Classes:
BasicNCAPBlock, BasicTIM, BasicTransducerBlock, ConfigureBlock, CSVFileTIM, DbConMgrBlock, DefaultCoder, DefaultXmlCoder, EchoBlock, ErrorChannelSplitter, FederationBlock, FunctionBlock, GaasPubBlock, GenericArgArrayStoreBlock, GenericStoreBlock, HttpTransport, HttpTransportJ2me, JddacServerDataBlock, JFreeChartBlock, LogAdminBlock, LogFileHandlerBlock, LogJdbcHandlerBlock, LogStdoutHandlerBlock, MeasInfoBlock, MeasStoreBlock, MemoryUsage, MessageQueueBlock, MetadataStoreBlock, MiniAlarmBlock, NCAPBlock, NRSSBlock, OneWireTIM, PingStim, ProbeBlock, PubDiagBlock, RandomData, RecordStoreBlock, RenamePubBlock, ReportDbAccess, Reporter, ReportOnChangeBlock, ReportStoreBlock, ServerInfoBlock, SimpleCounter, SimulatedTIM, TransportBridgeBlock, UserBlock
public interface SubscriberCallback

Entities which are to be called back by the SubscriberPort with a subscription need to implement this interface.

Note that the FunctionBlock class automatically implements this interface.

See Also:
SubscriberPort

Method Summary
 void notifySubscriber(short subscription_id, java.lang.String publicationTopic, ArgArray publisher_metadata)
          This is the method that is called by the SubscriberPort when a publication has been received.
 

Method Detail

notifySubscriber

void notifySubscriber(short subscription_id,
                      java.lang.String publicationTopic,
                      ArgArray publisher_metadata)
                      throws OpException
This is the method that is called by the SubscriberPort when a publication has been received.

Parameters:
subscription_id - The ID which was passed into the SubscriberPort when subscribing to topic
publicationTopic - The topic that the publication was published on.
publisher_metadata - The payload which was published.
Throws:
OpException
